``` {r setup, include=FALSE, echo=FALSE, results=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(euR)
library(knitr)
library(tinytex)
```

## Intro to R - ERIM Course

Some exercies to sketch plots.

```{r plot1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, fig.align='center', fig.height=3, fig.width=5}
ggplot(Prestige, aes(x = prestige, y = logincome)) +
  geom_point(color = "red")
ggplot(Prestige, aes(x = prestige)) +
  geom_histogram()
ggplot(data = mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE)
ggplot(Prestige, aes(x = type, y = prestige)) + 
  geom_boxplot()
ggplot(mpg, aes(cty, hwy)) +
  geom_point() +
  facet_grid( ~ fl)
ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, fill = class)) +
  geom_bar() +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "terrain_hcl")
ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = class)) + 
  geom_point() +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Reds")
ggplot(Feyenoord, aes(x = Year, y = Points)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 45, color = "red")
ggplot(Prestige, aes(x = education, y = prestige, fill = type)) + 
  geom_point(shape = 21, size = 2) + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE)
ggplot(mpg, aes(x = cty, y = hwy, fill = cty)) +
  geom_point(shape = 21, size = 3) +
  scale_fill_continuous(low = "white", high = "magenta")
ggplot(mpg, aes(x = cyl)) + 
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip()
```


This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
